dataset.shortName: Black sand soil moisture and snowdepth
dataset.title: Soil moisture and snowdepth measurements in the Black Sand experiment for East Knoll, Audubon, Lefty, Soddie and Trough, 2018 - 2024.

abstract.para: The purpose of the Black Sand experiment is to measure treatment effects on date of snowmelt on Niwot Ridge. Five sites with paired plots (treatment and control) were implemented across Niwot as part of the extended summer research program in order to understand the effects of earlier snowmelt. This dataset contains measurements of snowdepth throughout the melt season, manual measurements of volumetric water content and temperature data as an indication of snowmelt timing.

The Data User should realize that these data may be actively used by others for ongoing research and that coordination may be necessary to prevent duplicate publication. The Data User is urged to contact the authors of these data if any questions about methodology or results occur. Where appropriate, the Data User is encouraged to consider collaboration or co-authorship with the authors. The Data User should realize that misinterpretation of data may occur if used out of context of the original study. While substantial efforts are made to ensure the accuracy of data and associated documentation, complete accuracy of data sets cannot be guaranteed. All data are made available "as is." The Data User should be aware, however, that data are updated periodically and it is the responsibility of the Data User to check for new versions of the data. The data authors and the repository where these data were obtained shall not be liable for damages resulting from any use or misinterpretation of the data. Thank you.

maintenance.description: Updated metadata methods to correct rates of black sand application; corrected site locations in metadata; appended 2019 data [SCE 13 Feb 2020]. Updated comments in 2019 snow depth data; appended 2020 snow depth data; added 2020 soil moisture data; aligned column names and local site abbreviations across datasets [SCE 8 June 2021]. Appended 2021 snow depth measurements; harmonized treatment codes across years [SCE 13 Aug 2021]. Appended 2022 snow depth measurements including new column of distance from top of plot, added Jennifer Morse and Niwot Ridge to author list as measurement has transitioned to NWT staff [SCE 29 Nov 2022]. Added ibutton data from 2022-2023 which can be used to infer snowmelt timing; corrected misentered sample year in 2020 moisture datatable; added ocular estimates of snowmelt timing from 2018-2020; aligned site abbreviation names across tables [SCE/JGS/CF 29 Mar 2023]. Added manual snow measurements from 2023 as well as 2023 field season ibutton data. [SCE 8 Dec 2023]. Added corrected 2023 ibutton data that rectifies Audubon/Lefty COS2/COS6 duplicate labeling questions; remaining files unchanged. [SCE 13 Feb 2024] Added 2024 snow depth data. [JFM/ SCE 3 Sept 2024]

description.para: We accelerated snowmelt in one plot of each block by adding chemically inert black sand, while keeping the second plot as an unmanipulated control (black sand was added to these plots after snow had naturally melted). Five plots (each paired with treatment and control) were implemented, with each plot measuring 40 x 10 m in different locations. Snowmelt was accelerated in treatment plots using of 567g/ m2 black sand spread on the snow surface, control plots had the same amount of black sand applied after ambient snowmelt. To test the interactive effects of warming together with snowmelt, we established 3 control subplots per plot, and 3 subplots with passive ITEX warming chambers per plot (each site thus had 3 control, 3 warming, 3 early snowmelt and 3 early snowmelt + warming subplots).

Snow depth was measured ~3 times per week between sand application and snowmelt in both treatment and control plots. Measurements were taken in the same 5 spots for each observation using a snow probe.

In 2018: Soil moisture was measured ~3 times per week between sand application and snowmelt in both treatment and control plots. Measurements were taken in the same 5 spots for each observation using a handheld probe with 4.5" prongs. These measurements of soil moisture were discontinued in 2019, when continuous measurements were begun.

In 2020: We used a hand-held time domain reflectometry (TDR) FieldScout probe (Spectrum Technologies, Inc, IL, U.S.A.) on three different days in the late growing season (8/27, 9/1, 9/17) to take five measurements of volumetric water content of the soil in each of the 3 control and warming treatment subplots within each plot.
In 2018-2020 snowmelt was recorded in each pair of control and warmed ITEX subplots (A,B, or C within Early and Control plots) by visual observations.

To record snowmelt timing in 2021-2023 we put iButtons next to all eight 1 x 0.5 m subplots and all six 1 x 1 m ITEX subplots in each 10 x 40 m plot. In September, iButtons were buried as shallowly as possible (~1 cm) beneath the soil surface.

At all sites except Soddie, iButtons were placed in between adjacent warmed and control subplot pairs, so that the iButton indicated as being placed at ACWA is representative of both ACWA and ACCA. However, at the Soddie site, paired subplots are not immediately adjacent to each other. In 2021-2022, iButtons were placed next to all 12 ITEX subplots at Soddie. In 2022-2023 there only 4 iButtons for the six ITEX subplots in the Soddie Early Snowmelt plot, so iButtons were placed at SEWA, SECB, in between SECA/SEWB, and in between SEWC/SECC (labeled SEWC). ), iButtons were buried next to the right side of the subplot, looking uphill, as close to center as possible, except in a few subplots where it was not possible and they were buried along the left side instead. iButtons were retrieved as soon as possible after snowmelt the following field season.
For 2021-2022, we could not find iButtons at subplots: AEWA, ECOS4, LCOS1, LCOS4, LCOS5, LCOS8 and TEWA. The iButton at TCOS8 was found but had been pulled up and was on the ground surface.
For 2022-2023, data did not download from iButtons at ACOS2, ACOS6, LESS4, LESS5 and TCOS7. The iButtons at SECA/SEWB and SECB were not found.
Relative locations of all vegetation subplots within plots were measured in the summer of 2022. Diagram of measurements are included as a pdf with this data package.
Lefty control – July 15, 2021 (note some black sand applied to the lower section of Lefty Control plots that still had snow on June 20 inadvertently; scraped off July 1 and July 2)
Lefty control - July 14 (to majority of plot, which was already snow-free) and July 26 (to late-melting area), 2023
Trough control - July 14 (to majority of plot, which was already snow-free) and July 26 (to late-melting area), 2023
Black sand was NOT applied in 2024, although snowdepth measurements were taken in this year in order to understand the spatial variation in snow in the absence of treatment effects.

award.title: LTER: Long-term research on the dynamics of high-elevation ecosystems: A framework for understanding rates of ecological response to climate change
LTER: Long-term research on the dynamics of high-elevation ecosystems -- a framework for understanding ecological responsiveness to climate change
